Package com.example.appointment

Class ConnectionModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.appointment.ConnectionModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
SQLControllerInterface
public final class ConnectionModel extends Object implements SQLControllerInterface
A Singleton class that manages the database connection, and tracks the current language for the entire application. Password is stored as character array in order to improve security so that the password String is never saved into the String pool.

  • Field Summary

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentTime

      public ZonedDateTime getCurrentTime()
      A method that returns an object that contains the current time.
      Returns:
      ZonedDateTime - A ZonedDateTime object of the current time and ZoneID.

    • getInstance

      public static ConnectionModel getInstance()
      A method that returns an instance of the ConnectionModel object. It only creates a new
      Returns:
      a ConnectionModel object

    • establishConnection

      public void establishConnection(String username, char[] password) throws SQLException, SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that establishes the SQL database connection. If the database cannot be contacted then it will call itself 3 times. If after the 3rd time there is still not a connection, then an error message wil be generated and an exception will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      username - - The username that the user passes in through the login page.
      password - - The password that the user passes in through the login page.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the SQL database cannot be contacted.
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If the SQL connection is dropped and cannot be re-established.

    • getConnection

      public Connection getConnection() throws IOException
      A method that returns the connection object that is established with the establishConnection() method.
      Returns:
      A SQL connection object.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs.

    • SQLAlert

      public void SQLAlert() throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      Displays an alert window with the text for a SQL error message in case one occurs. This is seperated into its own method in order to improve code reuse.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - If the SQL connection is dropped and cannot be re-established.

    • getCurrentUsername

      public String getCurrentUsername()
      A method that returns the username of the current user.
      Returns:
      A string containing the current customer name.

    • setUserId

      public void setUserId(String username, char[] password) throws SQLConnectionDroppedException
      A method that sets the user ID based on the username that is passed into the login page.
      Parameters:
      username - - The username that the user passes in the login page.
      password - - The password that the user passes in the login page.
      Throws:
      SQLConnectionDroppedException - - If the SQL connection is dropped and cannot be re-established.

    • getUserId

      public Integer getUserId()
      A method that returns the user ID of the currently logged in user.
      Returns:
      the current user's user ID.

    • getResourceBundle

      public ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
      A method that returns the currently used resource bundle. This is essentially for allowing the program to change languages on the fly.
      Returns:
      the currently used resource bundle.

    • setCurrentLocale

      public void setCurrentLocale(Locale locale)
      A method that calls all the language translations methods to make it simpler to translate everything in the application. Because this class is a Singleton, this change will be reflected across every scene.
      Parameters:
      locale - takes in the user's default Locale.

    • getCurrentLocale

      public Locale getCurrentLocale()
      A method that returns the current user's selected locale.
      Returns:
      the currently selected user locale.
